ADSB_PORT.Description: This is the serial port number where SERIALx_PROTOCOL will be set to ADSB.

BRD_SERIAL_NUM.Description: Non-zero positive values will be shown on the CAN App Name string

BUZZER_VOLUME.Description: Control the volume of the buzzer

CAN2_BAUDRATE.Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

CAN2_PROTOCOL.Description: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver. At least one CAN port must be UAVCAN or else CAN1 gets set to UAVCAN
CAN2_PROTOCOL.DisplayName: Enable use of specific protocol to be used on this port

CAN3_BAUDRATE.Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

CAN3_PROTOCOL.Description: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver. At least one CAN port must be UAVCAN or else CAN1 gets set to UAVCAN
CAN3_PROTOCOL.DisplayName: Enable use of specific protocol to be used on this port

CAN_BAUDRATE.Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

CAN_NODE.Description: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly or 0 for dynamic node allocation
CAN_NODE.DisplayName: UAVCAN node that is used for this network

CAN_PROTOCOL.Description: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver. At least one CAN port must be UAVCAN or else CAN1 gets set to UAVCAN
CAN_PROTOCOL.DisplayName: Enable use of specific protocol to be used on this port

ESC_NUMBER.Description: This is the ESC number to report as in UAVCAN ESC telemetry feedback packets.

ESC_PWM_TYPE.Description: This selects the output PWM type, allowing for normal PWM continuous output, OneShot, brushed or DShot motor output

ESC_TELEM_PORT.Description: This is the serial port number where SERIALx_PROTOCOL will be set to ESC Telemetry

FLASH_BOOTLOADER.Description: DANGER! When enabled, the App will perform a bootloader update by copying the embedded bootloader over the existing bootloader. This may take a few seconds to perform and should only be done if you know what you're doing.

FORMAT_VERSION.Description: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

GPS_PORT.Description: This is the serial port number where SERIALx_PROTOCOL will be set to GPS.

LED_BRIGHTNESS.Description: Select the RGB LED brightness level.

LOG_BITMASK.Description: 4 byte bitmap of log types to enable

MB_CAN_PORT.Description: Autoselect dedicated CAN port on which moving baseline data will be transmitted.

Values.0: Sends moving baseline data on all ports
Values.1: auto select remaining port for transmitting Moving baseline Data

MSP_PORT.Description: This is the serial port number where SERIALx_PROTOCOL will be set to MSP

RNGFND_PORT.Description: This is the serial port number where SERIALx_PROTOCOL will be set to Rangefinder.

SYSID_THISMAV.Description: Allows setting an individual system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network
SYSID_THISMAV.DisplayName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle

ARSP2_AUTOCAL.Description: If this is enabled then the autopilot will automatically adjust the ARSPD_RATIO during flight, based upon an estimation filter using ground speed and true airspeed. The automatic calibration will save the new ratio to EEPROM every 2 minutes if it changes by more than 5%. This option should be enabled for a calibration flight then disabled again when calibration is complete. Leaving it enabled all the time is not recommended.
ARSP2_AUTOCAL.DisplayName: Automatic airspeed ratio calibration for 2nd airspeed sensor

ARSP2_BUS.Description: The bus number of the I2C bus to look for the sensor on

ARSP2_DEVID.Description: Airspeed2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

ARSP2_PIN.Description: Pin number indicating location of analog airspeed sensors. Pixhawk/Cube if set to 15.

ARSP2_PSI_RANGE.Description: This parameter allows you to to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device
ARSP2_PSI_RANGE.DisplayName: The PSI range of the device for 2nd sensor

ARSP2_SKIP_CAL.Description: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.
ARSP2_SKIP_CAL.DisplayName: Skip airspeed calibration on startup for 2nd sensor

ARSP2_TUBE_ORDR.Description: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.
ARSP2_TUBE_ORDR.DisplayName: Control pitot tube order of 2nd airspeed sensor

ARSP2_USE.Description: use airspeed for flight control. When set to 0 airspeed sensor can be logged and displayed on a GCS but won't be used for flight. When set to 1 it will be logged and used. When set to 2 it will be only used when the throttle is zero, which can be useful in gliders with airspeed sensors behind a propeller

ARSP_AUTOCAL.Description: Enables automatic adjustment of ARSPD_RATIO during a calibration flight based on estimation of ground speed and true airspeed. New ratio saved every 2 minutes if change is > 5%. Should not be left enabled.

ARSP_BUS.Description: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected

ARSP_DEVID.Description: Airspeed sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

ARSP_OPTIONS.Description: Bitmask of options to use with airspeed. 0:Disable use based on airspeed/groundspeed mismatch (see ARSPD_WIND_MAX), 1:Automatically reenable use based on airspeed/groundspeed mismatch recovery (see ARSPD_WIND_MAX) 2:Disable voltage correction

ARSP_PIN.Description: The pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to for analog sensors. Set to 15 on the Pixhawk for the analog airspeed port.

ARSP_PRIMARY.Description: This selects which airspeed sensor will be the primary if multiple sensors are found

ARSP_PSI_RANGE.Description: This parameter allows you to to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device
ARSP_PSI_RANGE.DisplayName: The PSI range of the device

ARSP_RATIO.Description: Calibrates pitot tube pressure to velocity. Increasing this value will indicate a higher airspeed at any given dynamic pressure.

ARSP_SKIP_CAL.Description: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

ARSP_TUBE_ORDER.Description: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

ARSP_USE.Description: Enables airspeed use for automatic throttle modes and replaces control from THR_TRIM. Continues to display and log airspeed if set to 0. Uses airspeed for control if set to 1. Only uses airspeed when throttle = 0 if set to 2 (useful for gliders with airspeed sensors behind propellers).

ARSP_WIND_MAX.Description: If the difference between airspeed and ground speed is greater than this value the sensor will be marked unhealthy. Using ARSPD_OPTION this health value can be used to disable the sensor.
ARSP_WIND_MAX.DisplayName: Maximum airspeed and ground speed difference

ARSP_WIND_WARN.Description: If the difference between airspeed and ground speed is greater than this value the sensor will issue a warning. If 0 ARSPD_WIND_MAX is used.
ARSP_WIND_WARN.DisplayName: Airspeed and ground speed difference that gives a warning

ARSPD2_AUTOCAL.Description: If this is enabled then the autopilot will automatically adjust the ARSPD_RATIO during flight, based upon an estimation filter using ground speed and true airspeed. The automatic calibration will save the new ratio to EEPROM every 2 minutes if it changes by more than 5%. This option should be enabled for a calibration flight then disabled again when calibration is complete. Leaving it enabled all the time is not recommended.

BARO1_DEVID.Description: Barometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

BARO2_DEVID.Description: Barometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

BARO3_DEVID.Description: Barometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

BARO_ALT_OFFSET.Description: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

BARO_EXT_BUS.Description: This selects the bus number for looking for an I2C barometer. When set to -1 it will probe all external i2c buses based on the GND_PROBE_EXT parameter.

BARO_FLTR_RNG.Description: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.
BARO_FLTR_RNG.DisplayName: Range in which sample is accepted

BARO_GND_TEMP.Description: User provided ambient ground temperature in degrees Celsius. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. A value of 0 means use the internal measurement ambient temperature.

BARO_PRIMARY.Description: This selects which barometer will be the primary if multiple barometers are found

BARO_PROBE_EXT.Description: This sets which types of external i2c barometer to look for. It is a bitmask of barometer types. The I2C buses to probe is based on GND_EXT_BUS. If BARO_EXT_BUS is -1 then it will probe all external buses, otherwise it will probe just the bus number given in GND_EXT_BUS.

BARO_SPEC_GRAV.Description: This sets the specific gravity of the fluid when flying an underwater ROV.

BARO1_WCF_BCK.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO1_WCF_BCK.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)

BARO1_WCF_ENABLE.Description: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

BARO1_WCF_FWD.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO1_WCF_FWD.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)

BARO1_WCF_LFT.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO1_WCF_LFT.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)

BARO1_WCF_RGT.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

BATT2_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATT2_AMP_PERVLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

BATT2_ARM_MAH.Description: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT2__ARM_VOLT parameter.

BATT2_ARM_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

BATT2_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BATT2_CRT_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATT2_CRT_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATT2_CURR_MULT.Description: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

BATT2_CURR_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

BATT2_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

BATT2_LOW_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT2_LOW_TIMER.Description: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

BATT2_LOW_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT2_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

Bitmask.1: MPPT reports input voltage and current

BATT2_OPTIONS.Description: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

BATT2_SERIAL_NUM.Description: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

BATT2_SUM_MASK.Description: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

BATT2_VLT_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

BATT2_VOLT_MULT.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT2_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

BATT2_VOLT_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

BATT3_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATT3_AMP_PERVLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

BATT4_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BATT4_CRT_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT4__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATT4_CRT_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT4_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT4_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATT4_CURR_MULT.Description: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

BATT4_CURR_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

BATT4_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

BATT4_LOW_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT4_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT4_LOW_TIMER.Description: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

BATT4_LOW_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT4_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT4_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT4_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

Bitmask.1: MPPT reports input voltage and current

BATT4_OPTIONS.Description: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

BATT4_SERIAL_NUM.Description: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

BATT4_SUM_MASK.Description: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

BATT4_VLT_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

BATT4_VOLT_MULT.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT4_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

BATT4_VOLT_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

BATT5_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATT5_AMP_PERVLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

BATT5_ARM_MAH.Description: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT5__ARM_VOLT parameter.

CAM_RC_BTN_DELAY.Description: Time it takes for the a RunCam button press to be actived in ms. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.
CAM_RC_BTN_DELAY.DisplayName: RunCam button delay before allowing further button presses

CAM_RC_BT_DELAY.Description: Time it takes for the RunCam to become fully ready in ms. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.
CAM_RC_BT_DELAY.DisplayName: RunCam boot delay before allowing updates

CAM_RC_CONTROL.Description: Specifies the allowed actions required to enter the OSD menu

CAM_RC_FEATURES.Description: The available features of the attached RunCam device. If 0 then the RunCam device will be queried for the features it supports, otherwise this setting is used.

CAM_RC_MDE_DELAY.Description: Time it takes for the a RunCam mode button press to be actived in ms. If a mode change first requires a video recording change then double this value is used. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.
CAM_RC_MDE_DELAY.DisplayName: RunCam mode delay before allowing further button presses

CAM_RC_TYPE.Description: RunCam deviee type used to determine OSD menu structure and shutter options.

COMPASS_AUTODEC.Description: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

COMPASS_AUTO_ROT.Description: When enabled this will automatically check the orientation of compasses on successful completion of compass calibration. If set to 2 then external compasses will have their orientation automatically corrected.

Values.3: use same tolerance to auto rotate 45 deg rotations

COMPASS_CAL_FIT.Description: This controls the fitness level required for a successful compass calibration. A lower value makes for a stricter fit (less likely to pass). This is the value used for the primary magnetometer. Other magnetometers get double the value.

COMPASS_CUS_PIT.Description: Compass mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

COMPASS_CUS_ROLL.Description: Compass mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

COMPASS_CUS_YAW.Description: Compass mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

COMPASS_DEC.Description: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

COMPASS_DEV_ID.Description: Compass device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID2.Description: Second compass's device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID3.Description: Third compass's device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID4.Description: Extra 4th compass's device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID5.Description: Extra 5th compass's device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID6.Description: Extra 6th compass's device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID7.Description: Extra 7th compass's device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID8.Description: Extra 8th compass's device id.  Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DIA2_X.Description: DIA_X in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_Y.Description: DIA_Y in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_Z.Description: DIA_Z in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_X.Description: DIA_X in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_Y.Description: DIA_Y in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_Z.Description: DIA_Z in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA_X.Description: DIA_X in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA_Y.Description: DIA_Y in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA_Z.Description: DIA_Z in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass. Note that this is separate from COMPASS_USE. This will enable the low level senor, and will enable logging of magnetometer data. To use the compass for navigation you must also set COMPASS_USE to 1.

COMPASS_EXTERN2.Description: Configure second compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.
COMPASS_EXTERN2.DisplayName: Compass2 is attached via an external cable

COMPASS_EXTERN3.Description: Configure third compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.
COMPASS_EXTERN3.DisplayName: Compass3 is attached via an external cable

COMPASS_EXTERNAL.Description: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.
COMPASS_EXTERNAL.DisplayName: Compass is attached via an external cable

COMPASS_FLTR_RNG.Description: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.
COMPASS_FLTR_RNG.DisplayName: Range in which sample is accepted

COMPASS_LEARN.Description: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets. You can enable learning either using a compass-only method that is suitable only for fixed wing aircraft or using the offsets learnt by the active EKF state estimator. If this option is enabled then the learnt offsets are saved when you disarm the vehicle. If InFlight learning is enabled then the compass with automatically start learning once a flight starts (must be armed). While InFlight learning is running you cannot use position control modes.

COMPASS_MOT2_X.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT2_X.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame X axis

COMPASS_MOT2_Y.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT2_Y.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Y axis

COMPASS_MOT2_Z.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT2_Z.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Z axis

COMPASS_MOT3_X.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT3_X.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame X axis

COMPASS_MOT3_Y.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT3_Y.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Y axis

COMPASS_MOT3_Z.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT3_Z.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Z axis

COMPASS_MOTCT.Description: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current.  Do not change manually.

COMPASS_MOT_X.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT_X.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis

COMPASS_MOT_Y.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT_Y.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis

COMPASS_MOT_Z.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)
COMPASS_MOT_Z.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis

COMPASS_ODI2_X.Description: ODI_X in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI2_Y.Description: ODI_Y in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI2_Z.Description: ODI_Z in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_X.Description: ODI_X in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_Y.Description: ODI_Y in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_Z.Description: ODI_Z in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI_X.Description: ODI_X in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI_Y.Description: ODI_Y in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI_Z.Description: ODI_Z in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_OFFS_MAX.Description: This sets the maximum allowed compass offset in calibration and arming checks

COMPASS_OFS2_X.Description: Offset to be added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame
COMPASS_OFS2_X.DisplayName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the X axis

COMPASS_OFS2_Y.Description: Offset to be added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame
COMPASS_OFS2_Y.DisplayName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis

COMPASS_OFS2_Z.Description: Offset to be added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame
COMPASS_OFS2_Z.DisplayName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis

COMPASS_OFS3_X.Description: Offset to be added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame
COMPASS_OFS3_X.DisplayName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the X axis

COMPASS_OFS3_Y.Description: Offset to be added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame
COMPASS_OFS3_Y.DisplayName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis

COMPASS_OFS3_Z.Description: Offset to be added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame
COMPASS_OFS3_Z.DisplayName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis

COMPASS_OFS_X.Description: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame
COMPASS_OFS_X.DisplayName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the X axis

COMPASS_OFS_Y.Description: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame
COMPASS_OFS_Y.DisplayName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Y axis

COMPASS_OFS_Z.Description: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame
COMPASS_OFS_Z.DisplayName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Z axis

COMPASS_OPTIONS.Description: This sets options to change the behaviour of the compass

COMPASS_ORIENT.Description: The orientation of the first external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation.

COMPASS_ORIENT2.Description: The orientation of a second external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used.

COMPASS_ORIENT3.Description: The orientation of a third external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used.

COMPASS_PRIO1_ID.Description: Compass device id with 1st order priority, set automatically if 0. Reboot required after change.
COMPASS_PRIO1_ID.DisplayName: Compass device id with 1st order priority

COMPASS_PRIO2_ID.Description: Compass device id with 2nd order priority, set automatically if 0. Reboot required after change.
COMPASS_PRIO2_ID.DisplayName: Compass device id with 2nd order priority

COMPASS_PRIO3_ID.Description: Compass device id with 3rd order priority, set automatically if 0. Reboot required after change.
COMPASS_PRIO3_ID.DisplayName: Compass device id with 3rd order priority

COMPASS_SCALE.Description: Scaling factor for first compass to compensate for sensor scaling errors. If this is 0 then no scaling is done

COMPASS_SCALE2.Description: Scaling factor for 2nd compass to compensate for sensor scaling errors. If this is 0 then no scaling is done

COMPASS_SCALE3.Description: Scaling factor for 3rd compass to compensate for sensor scaling errors. If this is 0 then no scaling is done

COMPASS_TYPEMASK.Description: This is a bitmask of driver types to disable. If a driver type is set in this mask then that driver will not try to find a sensor at startup

COMPASS_USE.Description: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

COMPASS_USE2.Description: Enable or disable the secondary compass for determining heading.

COMPASS_USE3.Description: Enable or disable the tertiary compass for determining heading.

COMPASS_PMOT1_X.Description: Compensation for X axis of motor1

COMPASS_PMOT1_Y.Description: Compensation for Y axis of motor1

COMPASS_PMOT1_Z.Description: Compensation for Z axis of motor1

COMPASS_PMOT2_X.Description: Compensation for X axis of motor2

COMPASS_PMOT2_Y.Description: Compensation for Y axis of motor2

COMPASS_PMOT2_Z.Description: Compensation for Z axis of motor2

COMPASS_PMOT3_X.Description: Compensation for X axis of motor3

COMPASS_PMOT3_Y.Description: Compensation for Y axis of motor3

COMPASS_PMOT3_Z.Description: Compensation for Z axis of motor3

COMPASS_PMOT4_X.Description: Compensation for X axis of motor4

COMPASS_PMOT4_Y.Description: Compensation for Y axis of motor4

COMPASS_PMOT4_Z.Description: Compensation for Z axis of motor4

COMPASS_PMOT_EXP.Description: This is the exponential correction for the power output of the motor for per-motor compass correction

EFI_COEF1.Description: Used to calibrate fuel flow for MS protocol (Slope)

EFI_COEF2.Description: Used to calibrate fuel flow for MS protocol (Offset)

EFI_TYPE.Description: What method of communication is used for EFI #1

FFT_ATT_REF.Description: FFT attenuation level in dB for bandwidth calculation and peak detection. The bandwidth is calculated by comparing peak power output with the attenuated version. The default of 15 has shown to be a good compromise in both simulations and real flight.

FFT_BW_HOVER.Description: FFT learned bandwidth at hover for the attenuation frequencies.

FFT_HMNC_FIT.Description: FFT harmonic fit frequency threshold percentage at which a signal of the appropriate frequency is determined to be the harmonic of another. Signals that have a harmonic relationship that varies at most by this percentage are considered harmonics of each other for the purpose of selecting the harmonic notch frequency. If a match is found then the lower frequency harmonic is always used as the basis for the dynamic harmonic notch. A value of zero completely disables harmonic matching.

FFT_HMNC_PEAK.Description: The FFT harmonic peak target that should be returned by FTN1.PkAvg. The resulting value will be used by the harmonic notch if configured to track the FFT frequency. By default the appropriate peak is auto-detected based on the harmonic fit between peaks and the energy-weighted average frequency on roll on pitch is used. Setting this to 1 will always target the highest energy peak. Setting this to 2 will target the highest energy peak that is lower in frequency than the highest energy peak. Setting this to 3 will target the highest energy peak that is higher in frequency than the highest energy peak. Setting this to 4 will target the highest energy peak on the roll axis only and only the roll frequency will be used (some vehicles have a much more pronounced peak on roll). Setting this to 5 will target the highest energy peak on the pitch axis only and only the pitch frequency will be used (some vehicles have a much more pronounced peak on roll).

FFT_MAXHZ.Description: Upper bound of FFT frequency detection in Hz. On smaller vehicles the maximum motor frequency is likely to be significantly higher than for larger vehicles.

FFT_MINHZ.Description: Lower bound of FFT frequency detection in Hz. On larger vehicles the minimum motor frequency is likely to be significantly lower than for smaller vehicles.

FFT_SAMPLE_MODE.Description: Sampling mode (and therefore rate). 0: Gyro rate sampling, 1: Fast loop rate sampling, 2: Fast loop rate / 2 sampling, 3: Fast loop rate / 3 sampling. Takes effect on reboot.

FFT_SNR_REF.Description: FFT SNR reference threshold in dB at which a signal is determined to be present.

FFT_THR_REF.Description: FFT learned thrust reference for the hover frequency and FFT minimum frequency.

FFT_WINDOW_OLAP.Description: Percentage of window to be overlapped before another frame is process. Takes effect on reboot. A good default is 50% overlap. Higher overlap results in more processed frames but not necessarily more temporal resolution. Lower overlap results in lost information at the frame edges.

FFT_WINDOW_SIZE.Description: Size of window to be used in FFT calculations. Takes effect on reboot. Must be a power of 2 and between 32 and 512. Larger windows give greater frequency resolution but poorer time resolution, consume more CPU time and may not be appropriate for all vehicles. Time and frequency resolution are given by the sample-rate / window-size. Windows of 256 are only really recommended for F7 class boards, windows of 512 or more H7 class.

FRSKY_DNLINK1_ID.Description: Change the first extra downlink sensor id (SPort only)

FRSKY_DNLINK2_ID.Description: Change the second extra downlink sensor id (SPort only)

FRSKY_DNLINK_ID.Description: Change the default downlink sensor id (SPort only)

FRSKY_OPTIONS.Description: A bitmask to set some FRSky Telemetry specific options

FRSKY_UPLINK_ID.Description: Change the uplink sensor id (SPort only)

GPS1_CAN_OVRIDE.Description: GPS Node id for first GPS. If 0 the gps will be automatically selected on first come basis.

GPS2_CAN_OVRIDE.Description: GPS Node id for second GPS. If 0 the gps will be automatically selected on first come basis.

GPS_AUTO_CONFIG.Description: Controls if the autopilot should automatically configure the GPS based on the parameters and default settings

Values.1: Enable automatic configuration for Serial GPSes only
Values.2: Enable automatic configuration for DroneCAN as well

GPS_AUTO_SWITCH.Description: Automatic switchover to GPS reporting best lock, 1:UseBest selects the GPS with highest status, if both are equal the GPS with highest satellite count is used 4:Use primary if 3D fix or better, will revert to 'UseBest' behaviour if 3D fix is lost on primary

Values.4: Use primary if 3D fix or better

GPS_BLEND_MASK.Description: Determines which of the accuracy measures Horizontal position, Vertical Position and Speed are used to calculate the weighting on each GPS receiver when soft switching has been selected by setting GPS_AUTO_SWITCH to 2(Blend)

GPS_BLEND_TC.Description: Controls the slowest time constant applied to the calculation of GPS position and height offsets used to adjust different GPS receivers for steady state position differences.

GPS_CAN_NODEID1.Description: GPS Node id for discovered first.

GPS_CAN_NODEID2.Description: GPS Node id for discovered second.

GPS_COM_PORT.Description: The physical COM port on the connected device, currently only applies to SBF GPS

GPS_COM_PORT2.Description: The physical COM port on the connected device, currently only applies to SBF GPS

GPS_DELAY_MS.Description: Controls the amount of GPS  measurement delay that the autopilot compensates for. Set to zero to use the default delay for the detected GPS type.

GPS_DELAY_MS2.Description: Controls the amount of GPS  measurement delay that the autopilot compensates for. Set to zero to use the default delay for the detected GPS type.

Bitmask.0: Use UART2 for moving baseline on ublox
Bitmask.1: Use base station for GPS yaw on SBF
Bitmask.3: Use dedicated CAN port b/w GPSes for moving baseline

GPS_GNSS_MODE.Description: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the first GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured)

GPS_GNSS_MODE2.Description: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the second GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured)

GPS_INJECT_TO.Description: The GGS can send raw serial packets to inject data to multiple GPSes.

GPS_MIN_DGPS.Description: Sets the minimum type of differential GPS corrections required before allowing to switch into DGPS mode.
GPS_MIN_DGPS.DisplayName: Minimum Lock Type Accepted for DGPS

GPS_MIN_ELEV.Description: This sets the minimum elevation of satellites above the horizon for them to be used for navigation. Setting this to -100 leaves the minimum elevation set to the GPS modules default.

GPS_POS1_X.Description: X position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS1_Y.Description: Y position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS1_Z.Description: Z position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS2_X.Description: X position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS2_Y.Description: Y position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS2_Z.Description: Z position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_PRIMARY.Description: This GPS will be used when GPS_AUTO_SWITCH is 0 and used preferentially with GPS_AUTO_SWITCH = 4.

GPS_RATE_MS.Description: Controls how often the GPS should provide a position update. Lowering below 5Hz(default) is not allowed. Raising the rate above 5Hz usually provides little benefit and for some GPS (eg Ublox M9N) can severely impact performance.

GPS_RATE_MS2.Description: Controls how often the GPS should provide a position update. Lowering below 5Hz(default) is not allowed. Raising the rate above 5Hz usually provides little benefit and for some GPS (eg Ublox M9N) can severely impact performance.

GPS_RAW_DATA.Description: Handles logging raw data; on uBlox chips that support raw data this will log RXM messages into logger; on Septentrio this will log on the equipment's SD card and when set to 2, the autopilot will try to stop logging after disarming and restart after arming

Values.5: Only log every five samples (uBlox only)

GPS_SAVE_CFG.Description: Determines whether the configuration for this GPS should be written to non-volatile memory on the GPS. Currently working for UBlox 6 series and above.

GPS_SBAS_MODE.Description: This sets the SBAS (satellite based augmentation system) mode if available on this GPS. If set to 2 then the SBAS mode is not changed in the GPS. Otherwise the GPS will be reconfigured to enable/disable SBAS. Disabling SBAS may be worthwhile in some parts of the world where an SBAS signal is available but the baseline is too long to be useful.

GPS_SBP_LOGMASK.Description: Masked with the SBP msg_type field to determine whether SBR1/SBR2 data is logged

GPS_MB1_OFS_X.Description: X position of the base GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_MB1_OFS_Y.Description: Y position of the base GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_MB1_OFS_Z.Description: Z position of the base GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_MB1_TYPE.Description: Controls the type of moving base used if using moving base.

GPS_MB2_OFS_X.Description: X position of the base GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_MB2_OFS_Y.Description: Y position of the base GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_MB2_OFS_Z.Description: Z position of the base GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_MB2_TYPE.Description: Controls the type of moving base used if using moving base.

LOG_BACKEND_TYPE.Description: Bitmap of what Logger backend types to enable. Block-based logging is available on SITL and boards with dataflash chips. Multiple backends can be selected.

LOG_BLK_RATEMAX.Description: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the mavlink backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.
LOG_BLK_RATEMAX.DisplayName: Maximum logging rate for block backend

LOG_DISARMED.Description: If LOG_DISARMED is set to 1 then logging will be enabled while disarmed. This can make for very large logfiles but can help a lot when tracking down startup issues

LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE.Description: The File and Block backends use a buffer to store data before writing to the block device.  Raising this value may reduce "gaps" in your SD card logging.  This buffer size may be reduced depending on available memory.  PixHawk requires at least 4 kilobytes.  Maximum value available here is 64 kilobytes.
LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE.DisplayName: Maximum AP_Logger File and Block Backend buffer size (in kilobytes)

LOG_FILE_DSRMROT.Description: When set, the current log file is closed when the vehicle is disarmed.  If LOG_DISARMED is set then a fresh log will be opened. Applies to the File and Block logging backends.
LOG_FILE_DSRMROT.DisplayName: Stop logging to current file on disarm

LOG_FILE_MB_FREE.Description: Set this such that the free space is larger than your largest typical flight log
LOG_FILE_MB_FREE.DisplayName: Old logs on the SD card will be deleted to maintain this amount of free space

LOG_FILE_RATEMAX.Description: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the file backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.
LOG_FILE_RATEMAX.DisplayName: Maximum logging rate for file backend

LOG_FILE_TIMEOUT.Description: This controls the amount of time before failing writes to a log file cause the file to be closed and logging stopped.
LOG_FILE_TIMEOUT.DisplayName: Timeout before giving up on file writes

LOG_MAV_BUFSIZE.Description: Maximum amount of memory to allocate to AP_Logger-over-mavlink
LOG_MAV_BUFSIZE.DisplayName: Maximum AP_Logger MAVLink Backend buffer size

LOG_MAV_RATEMAX.Description: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the mavlink backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.
LOG_MAV_RATEMAX.DisplayName: Maximum logging rate for mavlink backend

LOG_REPLAY.Description: If LOG_REPLAY is set to 1 then the EKF2 state estimator will log detailed information needed for diagnosing problems with the Kalman filter. It is suggested that you also raise LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE to give more buffer space for logging and use a high quality microSD card to ensure no sensor data is lost
LOG_REPLAY.DisplayName: Enable logging of information needed for Replay

MSP_OPTIONS.Description: A bitmask to set some MSP specific options

MSP_OSD_NCELLS.Description: Used for average cell voltage calculation

NTF_BUZZ_ON_LVL.Description: Specifies pin level that indicates buzzer should play

NTF_BUZZ_PIN.Description: Enables to connect active buzzer to arbitrary pin. Requires 3-pin buzzer or additional MOSFET!

NTF_BUZZ_TYPES.Description: Controls what types of Buzzer will be enabled

NTF_BUZZ_VOLUME.Description: Control the volume of the buzzer

NTF_DISPLAY_TYPE.Description: This sets up the type of on-board I2C display. Disabled by default.

NTF_LED_BRIGHT.Description: Select the RGB LED brightness level. When USB is connected brightness will never be higher than low regardless of the setting.

NTF_LED_LEN.Description: The number of Serial LED's to use for notifications (NeoPixel's and ProfiLED)

NTF_LED_OVERRIDE.Description: Specifies the source for the colours and brightness for the LED.  OutbackChallenge conforms to the MedicalExpress (https://uavchallenge.org/medical-express/) rules, essentially "Green" is disarmed (safe-to-approach), "Red" is armed (not safe-to-approach). Traffic light is a simplified color set, red when armed, yellow when the safety switch is not surpressing outputs (but disarmed), and green when outputs are surpressed and disarmed, the LED will blink faster if disarmed and failing arming checks.
NTF_LED_OVERRIDE.DisplayName: Specifies colour source for the RGBLed

NTF_LED_TYPES.Description: Controls what types of LEDs will be enabled

NTF_OREO_THEME.Description: Enable/Disable Solo Oreo LED driver, 0 to disable, 1 for Aircraft theme, 2 for Rover theme

OUT_DSHOT_ESC.Description: This sets the DShot ESC type for all outputs. The ESC type affects the range of DShot commands available. None means that no dshot commands will be executed.

OUT_DSHOT_RATE.Description: This sets the DShot output rate for all outputs as a multiple of the loop rate. 0 sets the output rate to be fixed at 1Khz for low loop rates. This value should never be set below 500Hz.

OUT_GPIO_MASK.Description: This sets a bitmask of outputs which will be available as GPIOs. Any auxillary output with either the function set to -1 or with the corresponding bit set in this mask will be available for use as a GPIO pin

OUT_RATE.Description: This sets the default output rate in Hz for all outputs.

OUT10_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

OUT10_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

OUT10_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

OUT10_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

OUT10_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

OUT11_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

OUT11_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

OUT11_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

OUT11_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

OUT11_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

OUT12_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

OUT12_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

OUT12_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

OUT_BLH_3DMASK.Description: Mask of channels which are dynamically reversible. This is used to configure ESCs in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction

OUT_BLH_AUTO.Description: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors
OUT_BLH_AUTO.DisplayName: BLHeli pass-thru auto-enable for multicopter motors

OUT_BLH_BDMASK.Description: Mask of channels which support bi-directional dshot. This is used for ESCs which have firmware that supports bi-directional dshot allowing fast rpm telemetry values to be returned for the harmonic notch.
OUT_BLH_BDMASK.DisplayName: BLHeli bitmask of bi-directional dshot channels

OUT_BLH_DEBUG.Description: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

OUT_BLH_MASK.Description: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)

OUT_BLH_OTYPE.Description: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

OUT_BLH_POLES.Description: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

OUT_BLH_PORT.Description: This sets the mavlink channel to use for blheli pass-thru. The channel number is determined by the number of serial ports configured to use mavlink. So 0 is always the console, 1 is the next serial port using mavlink, 2 the next after that and so on.

OUT_BLH_RVMASK.Description: Mask of channels which are reversed. This is used to configure ESCs in reversed mode

OUT_BLH_TEST.Description: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

OUT_BLH_TMOUT.Description: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

OUT_BLH_TRATE.Description: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

OUT_FTW_MASK.Description: Servo channel mask specifying FETtec ESC output.

OUT_FTW_RVMASK.Description: Servo channel mask to reverse rotation of FETtec ESC outputs.

OUT_ROB_POSMAX.Description: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

OUT_ROB_POSMIN.Description: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

OUT_SBUS_RATE.Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

OUT_VOLZ_MASK.Description: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

RNGFND1_ADDR.Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

RNGFND1_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

RNGFND1_GNDCLEAR.Description: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.
RNGFND1_GNDCLEAR.DisplayName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground

RNGFND1_MAX_CM.Description: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND1_MIN_CM.Description: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND1_OFFSET.Description: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

RNGFND1_PIN.Description: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V.

RNGFND1_POS_X.Description: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_PWRRNG.Description: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

RNGFND1_RECV_ID.Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

RNGFND1_RMETRIC.Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

RNGFND1_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts. For Maxbotix serial sonar this is unit conversion to meters.

RNGFND1_SNR_MIN.Description: Minimum signal strength (SNR) to accept distance

RNGFND1_STOP_PIN.Description: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range.

RNGFND1_WSP_AVG.Description: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

RNGFND1_WSP_FRQ.Description: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

RNGFND1_WSP_MAVG.Description: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

RNGFND1_WSP_MEDF.Description: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

RNGFND1_WSP_THR.Description: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

RNGFND5_WSP_AVG.Description: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

RNGFND5_WSP_FRQ.Description: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

RNGFND5_WSP_MAVG.Description: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

RNGFND5_WSP_MEDF.Description: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

RNGFND5_WSP_THR.Description: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

RNGFND6_ADDR.Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

RNGFND6_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

RNGFND6_GNDCLEAR.Description: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.
RNGFND6_GNDCLEAR.DisplayName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground

RNGFND6_MAX_CM.Description: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND6_MIN_CM.Description: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND6_OFFSET.Description: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

RNGFND6_PIN.Description: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V.

RNGFND6_POS_X.Description: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND6_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND6_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND6_PWRRNG.Description: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

RNGFND6_RECV_ID.Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

RNGFND6_RMETRIC.Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

Bitmask.3: log runtime memory usage and execution time

SCR_DIR_DISABLE.Description: This will stop scripts being loaded from the given locations

SCR_HEAP_SIZE.Description: Amount of memory available for scripting

SCR_USER1.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER2.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER5.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER6.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_VM_I_COUNT.Description: The number virtual machine instructions that can be run before considering a script to have taken an excessive amount of time

SERIAL0_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the USB console. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL0_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the console.

SERIAL1_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the Telem1 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL1_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.

SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem1 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

SERIAL2_BAUD.Description: The baud rate of the Telem2 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL2_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

SERIAL2_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem2 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

SERIAL3_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used for the Serial 3 (GPS). Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. SERIAL3_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

SERIAL3_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol Serial 3 (GPS) should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

SERIAL_PASS1.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASS2.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASSTIMO.Description: This sets a timeout for serial pass-through in seconds. When the pass-through is enabled by setting the SERIAL_PASS1 and SERIAL_PASS2 parameters then it remains in effect until no data comes from the first port for SERIAL_PASSTIMO seconds. This allows the port to revent to its normal usage (such as MAVLink connection to a GCS) when it is no longer needed. A value of 0 means no timeout.

VISO_DELAY_MS.Description: Visual odometry sensor delay relative to inertial measurements

VISO_POS_M_NSE.Description: Visual odometry position measurement noise minimum (meters). This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

VISO_POS_X.Description: X position of the camera in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.
VISO_POS_X.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera X position offset

VISO_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the camera in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.
VISO_POS_Y.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera Y position offset

VISO_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the camera in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.
VISO_POS_Z.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera Z position offset

VISO_SCALE.Description: Visual odometry scaling factor applied to position estimates from sensor

VISO_VEL_M_NSE.Description: Visual odometry velocity measurement noise in m/s

VISO_YAW_M_NSE.Description: Visual odometry yaw measurement noise minimum (radians), This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

VTX_ENABLE.Description: Toggles the Video Transmitter on and off
VTX_ENABLE.DisplayName: Is the Video Transmitter enabled or not

VTX_FREQ.Description: Video Transmitter Frequency. The frequency is derived from the setting of BAND and CHANNEL

VTX_MAX_POWER.Description: Video Transmitter Maximum Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, this prevents the power aux switch from requesting too high a power level. The switch supports 6 power levels and the selected power will be a subdivision between 0 and this setting.

Bitmask.4: Add leading zero byte to requests

VTX_OPTIONS.Description: Video Transmitter Options. Pitmode puts the VTX in a low power state. Unlocked enables certain restricted frequencies and power levels. Do not enable the Unlocked option unless you have appropriate permissions in your jurisdiction to transmit at high power levels.

VTX_POWER.Description: Video Transmitter Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, the power level chosen will be rounded down to the nearest supported power level
